text: @ The theory does not e require consumers to have identical preferences - they can be arbitrarily heterogeneous. e require the indifference curves of an individual to be nice, concentric translations of each other as often illustrated - they can be close together in some regions of commodity space, and far apart in others. e presuppose the existence of indifference curves - they are an empirically testable implication of choice behaviour based on well-behaved preferences. e The elementary theory does not even require utility functions - they are merely а convenience, you can “do” consumer theory without them.
